src:
英國冷凍貨櫃39死命案 死者全為越南籍
02 Nov 2019, 10:45 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社記者戴雅真倫敦2日專電）英國艾塞克斯郡10月23日發生冷凍貨櫃藏有39具遺體命案震驚全國，死者身分一度傳出為中國人，英國警方持續追查後，現在已經證實全部都為越南籍。
被英國媒體稱為「鐵棺材」的冷凍貨櫃由比利時濟布魯治（Zeebrugge）港口出發，跨海抵達英國艾塞克斯（Essex）的泰晤士河港口柏佛利特（Purfleet），10月23日凌晨被司機發現貨櫃內的屍體後報警，死者為31男8女。司機羅賓森（Maurice Robinson）被控過失殺人及共謀販運人口。
由於受害者攜帶的身分證件稀少，辨識身分不易，一度傳出死者全為中國籍，但後來發現可能是越南籍人士使用偽造的中國護照。
英國警方持續追查後證實，39名死者全部來自越南。
英國廣播公司（BBC）報導，艾塞克斯郡警方表示，已經直接聯絡上部分死者在英國或越南的家屬，也和越南政府有聯繫。
助理警察局長史密斯（Tim Smith）表示：「現階段我們認為所有受害者都是越南公民，並和越南政府保持密切聯繫。」但他表示，目前無法證實任何一名受害者的身分。
冷凍貨櫃命案傳出後，不少越南家屬憂心死者可能是自己的親屬，紛紛通報。
39名死者仍在進行驗屍，以辨明死因。
越南駐倫敦使館對這起事件表示哀痛，並對受害者家屬致上誠摯哀悼。使館指出：「受害者的確切身分仍須進一步證實，並由在越南或英國的家屬確認。」
事件爆發後，越南嚴查人蛇仲介偷渡，河靜省（Ha Tinh）已有兩人因相關罪名遭到起訴。（編輯：林憬屏）1081102

text:
British frozen container 39 deadly case The dead are all Vietnamese
02 Nov 2019, 10:45 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
(Central News Agency reporter Dai Yazhen, London, 2nd) The Essex County, England, on October 23, there were 39 dead bodies in the frozen container. The death of the deceased was once reported to the Chinese. After the British police continued to trace, it has now confirmed that Both are Vietnamese.
The frozen container, dubbed "iron coffin" by the British media, departs from the port of Zeebrugge, Belgium, and crosses the sea to the River Thames in Pursleet, Essex, England, on October 23 In the early morning, the driver found the body inside the container and called the police. The deceased was 31 men and 8 women. Driver Maurice Robinson was charged with manslaughter and conspiring to traffic in human beings.
Due to the scarcity of identity documents carried by the victims, it was not easy to identify the identity. It was once transmitted to the Chinese nationals, but it was later discovered that Vietnamese nationals might use forged Chinese passports.
The British police continued to trace and confirmed that all 39 people were from Vietnam.
The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) reported that the Essex County police said they had contacted the families of the deceased in the UK or Vietnam and had contact with the Vietnamese government.
Assistant Police Commissioner Tim Smith said: "At this stage we believe that all victims are Vietnamese citizens and maintain close contact with the Vietnamese government." However, he said that it is currently impossible to confirm the identity of any victim.
After the murder of the frozen container, many Vietnamese family members worried that the deceased may be their relatives and have notified them.
The 39 deceased were still undergoing an autopsy to identify the cause of death.
The Vietnamese Embassy in London expressed its sorrow over the incident and expressed sincere condolences to the families of the victims. The Embassy stated: "The exact identity of the victim still needs to be further confirmed and confirmed by family members in Vietnam or the United Kingdom."
After the outbreak of the incident, Viet Nam strictly investigated the smuggling of the snake, and two people in Ha Tinh were prosecuted for related charges. (Edit: Lin Yiping) 1081102
